name: TRY_CAST
shortDescription: Convert value to specified type, NULL on failure
description: Attempts to convert an expression to the specified data type. Returns NULL if conversion fails instead of raising an error.

examples.title: Safe string to number
examples.sql: SELECT TRY_CAST(user_input AS INT) as parsed_number FROM submissions

examples.title: Handle invalid data
examples.sql: SELECT * FROM data WHERE TRY_CAST(value AS INT) IS NOT NULL

examples.title: With COALESCE
examples.sql: SELECT COALESCE(TRY_CAST(input AS INT), 0) as safe_number FROM data

notes: Returns NULL instead of error on conversion failure
Useful for data cleaning and validation
